main event: A bright white flash was observed in the sky by multiple observers in the Northwest Territories of Canada, followed by the sighting of a round, white object resembling a magnesium flare, which fell in a downward arc and then disappeared suddenly.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a basketball held at arm's length.
The object had a whitish vapor trail that was much thinner than a normal jet vapor trail and lasted for 5-10 minutes.
The object increased in brightness before completely disappearing about 15 degrees above the horizon.
The observers were widely separated but their reports were remarkably similar, suggesting a genuine sighting of an unidentified flying object.
The report suggests the possibility of the object being the re-entry of a missile into the Earth's atmosphere.
sighted object: round, white object resembling a magnesium flare
witnesses: multiple observers, including a heavy equipment operator, supply specialist, C&E supervisor, and Eskimo apprentice heavy equipment operator
